content.description: Flake and crack climbing to a tough finish.
content.protection: Red C3 to Red C4, Nuts, Micro-Nuts, 3 bolts, chain anchor.
content.location: Situated between the arete and the major overhang.

content.description: Start with a bit of stemming on right, up some face and then ride the blunt arete on the right to the top. Some tricky tension moves and slight feet make this interesting.
content.location: On SE side of the Lost Arrow Spire. This is the bolted route left of the Bein Crack.

climbs.name: Empty Quiver
climbs.fa: Mike Engle, Mark Jacobs  1985 Ground Up

content.description: W-Facing. Climb the west corner past two bolts to gain a finger crack. Follow this crack to a horizontal, the move up and right past two more bolts (crux).
content.protection: Red C3-#2, Nuts, 4 bolts, chain anchor.
content.location: West edge of L.A.S. left of the major overhang on the south face.

climbs.name: Clip It Or Skip It
climbs.fa: Feb. 2021 Ground Up Gabe & Rachel Skiera

content.description: Tightly spaced bolts and fun climbing with a cool position.
content.location: Crawl through the hole in the gully that separates LA Spire from Sentinel. Climbers right of 'Caught In The Act'.Look up and left and the first bolt will be right there. On the north side of the formation.

content.description: Stem across the gully to clip the first bolt, proceed directly above to gain a nice ledge.  From the ledge, take the finger crack as it widens and eventually ends; then continue up and left to the anchors.
content.location: On the east side of L.A.S. Found in the top of the gully that divides BB and L.A.S.. It is 25 up the dirt gully from the large pine tree located at the bottom of the gully.

content.description: S-Facing. Climb the dihedral and veer right with the crack at the bulge. At 70 feet, look for a bolt on the face above the crack. Find a way onto the slab, and continue to the anchors.
content.location: Just right of the major overhang on the south face.

climbs.name: The Bein Crack
climbs.fa: Kevin Bein, Barbara Devine, Lane Smith, Brent Kertzman,-1980  Ground Up  1980

content.description: Climb the detached flake to gain the finger crack on the East face. reach the ledge, then take the finger crack up and right to the anchors.
content.location: This is the finger crack just right of the east arete. The start is located five feet up the dirty gully from the large pine tree found at the bottom of the gully that divides BB and L.A.S.
